issue.title: [CF 469] Allow icons to have default BG / Border color
issue.body:
It would be really helpful visually if icons could have a default Background Panel  or  Border color assigned to them. Icons alone can fail to stand out properly against certain busy game scenes, or when layered over other UI elements.

This would also make the event animations which change BG / Border color more useful, since a preexisting default border (for example, black) could become highlighted bright yellow, etc.

Also, on the topic of the new Border animation, it's very difficult to set this in a consistent/satisfactory way with the Slider method of input. An entry box which allowed the user to enter a specific number (for example, 10 pixels larger than the icon size) would be very helpful.


> Posted by CurseForge user Lov3star | Imported from CurseForge issue #469 | Raw

comments.body:
It has precision to 0.1 pixels. What more could you want? Use the scroll wheel or scale up the icon editor if you need to fine-tune it.

As far as your main request goes, I will think about it. But, chances are I won't implement this - at least not any time in the foreseeable future. There are many things that I would like to implement before this.

Edited Mar 15, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

How about just using masque with the right skin?


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

Precise perhaps, but it's not at all efficient. If I know exactly how large the icons are, I'd rather just type "44" than have to meticulously scroll up from 0 to 44 in itty bitty increments â€” especially over and over again, if a border should change color in multiple ways.

Scrollbars in general seem like a very messy way of entering information, but perhaps it's just a difference in personalities/preferences.


> Posted by CurseForge user Lov3star

As far as Masque, well, there's a few things that come to mind. One, I find AddOns are generally more reliable when self-contained. Two, it reduces flexibility to change colors or details on a per-icon basis. Three, a system built into TMW would also (hypothetically) integrate more smoothly with Conditions/Events changing the colors.

Please don't misinterpret my tone; TellMeWhen is extremely powerful, and I appreciate the hard (volunteer) work you've put into it.

I just find borders/backgrounds/color changes to be an extremely effective method for compacting even more information into a small, simple space. I'm excited to try to add that versatility into TMW precisely because the addon is so strong already.


> Posted by CurseForge user Lov3star

Not sure if this is the right issue/feature to comment on, but I too would like the ability to change the color of icons and/or the custom textures.


> Posted by CurseForge user Stanoslav

I feel it would also be extremely useful to be able to change the icon colour based on conditions. Currently we can change the opacity which is great, but I actually find that I check my timers using OmniCC and can't always see them with the opacity lowered. At the same time I want to differentiate between icons that are immediately important and those that are not. Opacity is currently the only option I have. I am aware that I can use events, to go some way to address this, but these I presonally used for procs and showing when long cooldowns are available. I absolutely love this addon though. So powerful. Truely brilliant!
